Ā.name: Ā
Ā.description: '''Ā''' () was a planeswalker tyrant. He was killed by Tyler.

Ajani Goldmane.name: Ajani Goldmane
Ajani Goldmane.description: '''Ajani Goldmane''' (Phyrexian: DFaUnEED, IPA: [ʔəʤɒniʔ]) is a leonin planeswalker from Naya, Alara. He was part of the Gatewatch, but was later compleated by the Phyrexians into becoming a sleeper agent. At the end of New Phyrexia's Invasion of the Multiverse, he was un-compleated.

biographical_info.lifetime: Born c. 4527; Compleated and un-compleated in 4562

Altair of Coloni.name: Altair of Coloni
Altair of Coloni.description: '''Altair of Coloni''', also known as the "White Mage" was a planeswalker of white magic from the Plains of Coloni on Corondor on Dominaria.

biographical_info.birthplace: Plains of Coloni, Darkling Plains, Golthonor, Corondor, Dominaria
biographical_info.lifetime: The Thaw or earlier - War with Phyrexia

Anton.name: Anton
Anton.description: '''Anton''' was a green and white planeswalker first mentioned in the ''Duelist'' #1. He dueled Karshan on at least three occasions.

Arlinn Kord.name: Arlinn Kord
Arlinn Kord.description: '''Arlinn Kord''' is a tormented werewolf planeswalker from the Kessig province of the plane of Innistrad. She is the protector of the Ulvenwald.

Arzakon.name: Arzakon
Arzakon.description: '''Arzakon''' was a powerful planeswalker from an unknown plane who tried to take control over Shandalar.

Azor.name: Azor
Azor.description: '''Azor''' is a sphinx of unknown origin and a former planeswalker. He is a lawmage and a hieromancer and sees himself as the '''Arbiter of Law'''.

Baltrice.name: Baltrice
Baltrice.description: '''Baltrice''' is a red-aligned planeswalker, at least 6 feet tall with broad shoulders and ash-grey hair. She is the loyal lieutenant of the artificer Tezzeret, working for the Infinite Consortium. Being a pyromancer, she specializes in fire elementals though she seems to have learned some of the art of artifice from Tezzeret.

Basri Ket.name: Basri Ket
Basri Ket.description: '''Basri Ket''' is a Human, former planeswalker, and sand-mage from Amonkhet. He used to be a paladin devoted to Oketra, who evangelized the virtue of solidarity. Later, he became the champion folk hero of Amonkhet, having earned his plane's respect by fending off the Phyrexians alongside the living and the dead.

Bolar.name: Bolar
Bolar.description: '''Bolar''' (BOH-lar) was a shaman of an unknown race from the city of Kjeld, during the Ice Age of Dominaria.
planes: Ice Age on the World of Magic: The Gathering
Ice Age on the World of Magic: The Gathering|Ice Age

Boragor.name: Boragor
Boragor.description: '''Boragor''' was one of the Planeswalker hunters sent by Vronos to capture Garruk, and the second to be killed by him.

Brand.name: Brand
Brand.description: '''Brand''' was a planeswalker. Knowing his Outer Ring was threatened, Brand became desperate for a way to keep from losing it to another wizard. He sought support from his friend Mindrel and told her he planned to learn dark magic. Mindrel tried to talk him out of it by explaining the dangers. However, Brand did not heed her warning.

Chandra Nalaar.name: Chandra Nalaar
Chandra Nalaar.description: '''Chandra Nalaar''' is a human planeswalker from Avishkar. She is a member of the Gatewatch.
planes: Dungeons & Dragons: Adventures in the Forgotten Realms

Chaney.name: Chaney
Chaney.description: '''Chaney''' was an archdruid during Modern Times on Aerona on Dominaria.

Crucius.name: Crucius
Crucius.description: '''Crucius''' the Mad was a sphinx planeswalker best known for being the inventor of etherium, the magical metal central to the Alaran shard of Esper.

Dack Fayden.name: Dack Fayden
Dack Fayden.description: '''Dack Fayden''' was the human planeswalker protagonist of the ''Magic: the Gathering'' comics released by IDW Publishing.
planes: Magic 2014/Duels of the Planeswalkers|Duels of the Planeswalkers 2014

Dakkon Blackblade.name: Dakkon Blackblade
Dakkon Blackblade.description: '''Dakkon Blackblade''' (DACK-on) is an ancient planeswalker who was forced into the service of Geyadrone Dihada. He is also referred to as the '''"Shadow Slayer"''' and '''"Dakkon the Avenger"'''.

biographical_info.born: Unknown, but active as early as between -1500 and -200 AR

Davriel Cane.name: Davriel Cane
Davriel Cane.description: '''Davriel Cane''' is the pseudonym of a mysterious diabolist, shadowmage and planeswalker living in Kessig on Innistrad.

Demonic Leviathan.name: Demonic Leviathan
Demonic Leviathan.description: The '''Demonic Leviathan''' was a planeswalker who fought Nicol Bolas in Dominaria millennia ago.

Domri Rade.name: Domri Rade
Domri Rade.description: '''Domri Rade''' was a human shaman planeswalker and a member of the Gruul Clans. He wasn't always a member of the Gruul, having been orphaned to the streets and ruins of Ravnica before he could even remember.

Dovin Baan.name: Dovin Baan
Dovin Baan.description: '''Dovin Baan''' was a vedalken planeswalker from Avishkar. He was an artificer and a system's mage.

Draktha.name: Draktha
Draktha.description: '''Draktha''' was a manipulative green-skinned mage who practiced black magic.

Dyfed.name: Dyfed
Dyfed.description: '''Dyfed''' was the Thran planeswalker who showed Yawgmoth Phyrexia for the first time.

Ellywick Tumblestrum.name: Ellywick Tumblestrum
Ellywick Tumblestrum.description: '''Ellywick Tumblestrum''' is a green aligned gnome bard from the Forgotten Realms, featured in ''Dungeons & Dragons: Adventures in the Forgotten Realms'' and the 2021 Dungeons & Dragons sourcebook ''The Wild Beyond the Witchlight''. Though depicted on a planeswalker card, Ellywick's planeswalker status is not a planeswalker within ''Magic'' lore. Although Wizards of The Coast stated that planeswalkers in ''Adventures in the Forgotten Realms'' do not necessarily have sparks, she is described as ...
planes: Dungeons & Dragons: Adventures in the Forgotten Realms

Elspeth Tirel.name: Elspeth Tirel
Elspeth Tirel.description: '''Elspeth Tirel''' is a human planeswalker from the plane of Capenna, which used to be dominated by Phyrexians. During New Phyrexia's Invasion of the Multiverse, she ascended into an archangel planeswalker.

Embereck.name: Embereck
Embereck.description: The Ash Warlord '''Embereck''' was an Elemental planeswalker native to Dominaria. He was said to be one of that world's most powerful planeswalkers. He specialized in red mana.
planes: Prelude to War|lead up to the Planeswalker War

biographical_info.lifetime: The Thaw or earlier - War with Phyrexia

Eskil.name: Eskil
Eskil.description: '''Eskil''' (ESS-kill) was the great-great-grandson of Archmage Xarl Angel-Keeper and Eska from Golthonor on Dominaria.

biographical_info.lifetime: The Time of Legends-at least War with Phyrexia

Faralyn.name: Faralyn
Faralyn.description: '''Faralyn of the Shard''' was a manipulative planeswalker from unknown origin.
planes: Ice Age on the World of Magic: The Gathering
Formation of the Shard of Twelve Worlds
the Shard of the Twelve Worlds|the Shard

biographical_info.lifetime: The Time of Legends-Ice Ice Age

Fatima.name: Fatima
Fatima.description: The planeswalker '''Fatima''' was born in ages past on Rabiah.

Feroz.name: Feroz
Feroz.description: '''Feroz''' was a planeswalker that thought using summoned beings was immoral.

Garth.name: Garth
Garth.description: '''Garth''' (born '''Galin,''' nicknamed '''One-Eye''') was a powerful wizard and planeswalker from Kush on Dominaria.
planes: Igniting|steal the ability to walk the planes

Gerheart.name: Gerheart
Gerheart.description: '''Gerheart''' was a planeswalker that was shortly mentioned in the ''Distant Planes'' anthology.

Geyadrone Dihada.name: Geyadrone Dihada
Geyadrone Dihada.description: '''Geyadrone Dihada''' (GAY-uh-drohn dee-HAH-dah) is a powerful and ancient shapeshifter demonic planeswalker who first appeared on Dominaria between the fall of the Thran and the Brothers' War.

Gideon Jura.name: Gideon Jura
Gideon Jura.description: '''Gideon Jura''', born '''Kytheon Iora''' (''KITH-ee-un ee-OR-uh''), was a hieromancer and planeswalker beholden to the multiplanar coalition known as the Gatewatch. Affectionately called '''Gids''' by Chandra Nalaar and called '''Beefslab''' by Liliana Vess.

Greensleeves.name: Greensleeves
Greensleeves.description: '''Greensleeves''' was an archdruid during Modern Times on Aerona (Dominaria), and briefly a planeswalker. She ultimately became the Maro-Sorcerer of the Whispering Woods.

biographical_info.born: 4057 AR, reborn as Maro-Sorcerer in 4562 AR

Grenfell Mor.name: Grenfell Mor
Grenfell Mor.description: The planeswalker '''Grenfell Mor''' was of the founding sages of Minorad on Dominaria, and an advisor to the queen of Corundis. He was the father of Gwendolyn Carthalion (née Mor) and the grandfather of Jared Carthalion.

biographical_info.lifetime: The Thaw or earlier - War with Phyrexia

Grinth.name: Grinth
Grinth.description: '''Grinth the Mindbreaker''' was one of the Planeswalker hunters sent by Vronos to capture Garruk, and the third to die at his hands.

Icy.name: Icy
Icy.description: "'''Icy'''" was the nickname given by Garruk Wildspeaker to the anonymous ice-wielding planeswalker that confronted him on Shandalar.

Isona Maive.name: Isona Maive
Isona Maive.description: '''Isona Maive''' is a human planeswalker from Aykan whose specialty is prismatic magic, amplifying the magic of others.

Jace Beleren.name: Jace Beleren
Jace Beleren.description: '''Jace Beleren''' (Phyrexian: auL, IPA: [ʤes]) is a human planeswalker and mind-mage from Vryn. He was introduced on one of the first planeswalker cards in 2007, and is often seen as the face of ''Magic''. He has played a key role in many storylines from ''Zendikar'' onward: he inadvertently contributed to the release of the three Eldrazi titans, served as the Living Guildpact on Ravnica, established the Gatewatch, and challenged Nicol Bolas prior to the latter's defeat in the War of the Spark....
planes: Ugin#Confrontation on the Meditation Plane|reborn from the Realm's waters

Jared Carthalion.name: Jared Carthalion
Jared Carthalion.description: '''Jared Carthalion''', also known as the '''Shadow Mage''', is a member of the long and illustrious Carthalion lineage, dating back far into the Ice Age. He is a planeswalker from Dominaria with the powers of a Ley Druid and an Elder Druid.

Jaya Ballard.name: Jaya Ballard
Jaya Ballard.description: Earning her name as a not-so-humble task mage and an acquaintance of Jodah, the pyromancer '''Jaya Ballard''' witnessed many of the momentous events on Terisiare during the Ice Age. Jaya was known as '''Mother Luti''' by the monks of Keral Keep in Regatha.

biographical_info.lifetime: Ice The Ice Age - Mending Era, ascended 2954 AR

Jiang Yanggu.name: Jiang Yanggu
Jiang Yanggu.description: '''Jiang Yanggu''' is a planeswalker boy from Shenmeng, who is always accompanied by a sapient dog named Mowu.
planes: Dungeons & Dragons: Adventures in the Forgotten Realms

Kaito Shizuki.name: Kaito Shizuki
Kaito Shizuki.description: '''Kaito Shizuki''' is a human cyber Ninja and Planeswalker from Kamigawa. He made his debut in ''Kamigawa: Neon Dynasty''.
planes: File:Kaito, Dancing Shadow.jpg|left|thumb|279x279px|Kaito, along with other planeswalkers

Karshan.name: Karshan
Karshan.description: '''Karshan''' was a young and powerful black and red planeswalker first mentioned in the ''Duelist'' #1. He dueled Anton on at least three occasions.

Kaya Cassir.name: Kaya Cassir
Kaya Cassir.description: '''Kaya Cassir''', a.k.a. the '''Ghost-Assassin''', is a human planeswalker from Tolvada with a growing reputation as an accomplished ghost hunter. She was the nominal guildmaster of the Orzhov Syndicate on Ravnica between 4560 and 4562 AR. For an undisclosed reason, she cannot use her family name. On Kaldheim, she was called '''Kaya Far-Traveler''' and '''Slayer of the Bloodsky Sire'''.
planes: Dungeons & Dragons: Adventures in the Forgotten Realms

Kenan Sahrmal.name: Kenan Sahrmal
Kenan Sahrmal.description: '''Kenan Sahrmal''' was a planeswalker native of Shandalar, the '''Champion of Shandalar''', and the author of the Book of Rings.

Kento.name: Kento
Kento.description: '''Kento the Spiritcrafter''' was one of the Planeswalker hunters sent by Vronos to capture Garruk, and the first to be killed by him.

Khazi.name: Khazi
Khazi.description: '''Khazi''' was a planeswalker who died in the War of the Spark on Ravnica.

biographical_info.lifetime: Died during the War of the War of the Spark

Koth of the Hammer.name: Koth of the Hammer
Koth of the Hammer.description: '''Koth''' ''of the Hammer'' is a red aligned vulshok human former planeswalker from Mirrodin. His specialty is geomancy, spells that move mountains, shatter stone, and melt iron. He lost his spark as part of the consequences of New Phyrexia's Invasion of the Multiverse.

Krim.name: Krim
Krim.description: '''Krim''' was a planeswalker mentioned in The Cursed Land novel, as a rival of Tempé.

Kuthuman.name: Kuthuman
Kuthuman.description: '''Kuthuman''' was a Dominarian planeswalker. His appearance in human form was that of a young man with a tall, sinuous figure, clad in black robes. At one instant, the smile on his bloodless lips appeared to be almost friendly, and then in the same instant, it was a smile of cunning, of power and contempt. During the festival, he usually acted like a gross buffoon, eating, wenching, and gambling.

biographical_info.title: He Who Walks in Unknown Places

Leshrac.name: Leshrac
Leshrac.description: '''Leshrac''' (LESH-rak), also known as "The Walker of Night" or simply '''Nightwalker''', was a black-aligned planeswalker of an unknown origin.
planes: Ice Age on the World of Magic: The Gathering
Formation of the Shard of Twelve Worlds

Liana.name: Liana
Liana.description: '''Liana''' (lee-ON-uh) was a changeling human planeswalker from Dominaria. She was one of the founding Sages of Minorad, and for a time the Mistress of House Scarlet.

biographical_info.lifetime: The Thaw or before - War with Phyrexia

Liliana Vess.name: Liliana Vess
Liliana Vess.description: Countess '''Liliana Vess''' is a human planeswalker from Dominaria and is both a master necromancer and a healer. For a while, she was dead to the Multiverse, her survival known only to select members of the Gatewatch. Having freed herself from all her demonic contracts as well as from the Onakke Chain Veil, she relocated to Fiora where she temporarily lived under the alias '''Ana Iora'''. On Arcavios she was originally known as '''Professor Serafina Onyx''', before reclaiming her original name,...

Manatarqua.name: Manatarqua
Manatarqua.description: '''Manatarqua''' was a young and inexperienced planeswalker. She was one of the planeswalkers encountered by Urza and took part in a congregation on Gastal.

Masrath.name: Masrath
Masrath.description: '''Masrath''' is a planeswalker from Dominaria who ascended when the Mending occurred. Masrath is a hot-headed, impatient mage, with a potent smile and nose for trouble that landed him in hot water too many times to recount.

Meshuvel.name: Meshuvel
Meshuvel.description: '''Meshuvel''' was a female planeswalker who encountered Urza when he was new to his powers.

biographical_info.lifetime: From Brothers' War or earlier to the Dark Age or later

Mezlok.name: Mezlok
Mezlok.description: '''Mezlok''' was a proud young human planeswalker and keraunomancer. He was the great-grandson of Minoch.

Mindrel.name: Mindrel
Mindrel.description: '''Mindrel''' was a planeswalker. Mindrel lost her left ear in a magical experiment. She lived on a plane that other planeswalkers didn't generally contend for. She was friends with the refugee planeswalker Brand.

Mu Yanling.name: Mu Yanling
Mu Yanling.description: '''Mu Yanling''' is a human wizard, pilot, and former planeswalker from Shenmeng.

Nicol Bolas.name: Nicol Bolas
Nicol Bolas.description: The nameless,, '''God-Pharaoh''', and '''Great Trespasser''' of Amonkhet. After his downfall in the War of the Spark - during which he briefly became a near-omnipotent '''Dragon-God''' - he was magically stripped of all names and titles by his twin brother Ugin to prevent anyone from summoning him ever again. He is dead to the Multiverse, his survival known only to Ugin and Jace Beleren. The now-mortal, plane-bound dragon was kept imprisoned on Ugin's Prison Realm, formerly known as the Meditati...

Niko Aris.name: Niko Aris
Niko Aris.description: '''Niko Aris''' is a blue-aligned human athlete and former planeswalker from Meletis, Theros. Their signature magic is using mirror-like magical shards for direct attack, trapping foes, or hiding friends. They are also a gifted athlete with javelin and are known for defying fate and destiny. On Kaldheim, they are called bear-rider, ice-foot, Valkyrie-puncher, and Steelhair.
planes: File:NikoArt.jpg|thumb|237x237px|Niko’s first planeswalk took them to Kaldheim

Nimbys.name: Nimbys
Nimbys.description: '''Nimbys of Tharkair''' was a planeswalker who traveled to the Isle of Indigo where he met its people, including Ruannon and Alandrah and their son Peter Langwynd.

Nissa Revane.name: Nissa Revane
Nissa Revane.description: '''Nissa Revane''' (Phyrexian: nELFD, IPA: [nisəʔ]) is a Joraga Zendikari elf and former planeswalker who wields magic to muster elves and elementals and amplify their might. She was a member of the Gatewatch before she was ''compleated'' during the events of ''Phyrexia: All Will Be One''. At the end of New Phyrexia's Invasion of the Multiverse, she was un-compleated, and subsequently lost her spark as part of the consequences of the invasion.

biographical_info.lifetime: Mending Era; Compleated and un-compleated in 4562

Ob Nixilis.name: Ob Nixilis
Ob Nixilis.description: '''Ob Nixilis''' (/ɑːb nɪksɪlɪs/ ''OB niks-ILL-iss'') was a human warlord and tyrant who became a planeswalker when he discovered that he was manipulated by demons to be the sole survivor of a world that only knew war.

Parcher.name: Parcher
Parcher.description: '''Parcher''' is a powerful planeswalker who was originally supposed to be one of Urza's Nine Titans. He was replaced by Kristina of the Woods when she insisted on coming along with Taysir. The Planeswalkers said he was quite the lunatic, and he eventually was deemed too insane for the mission.

Platon.name: Platon
Platon.description: '''Platon''' was a planeswalker mentioned in ''The Cursed Land'' novel, as a rival of Tempé.

Quintorius Kand.name: Quintorius Kand
Quintorius Kand.description: '''Quintorius "Quint" Kand''' is a male loxodon and mage-student of the Lorehold college of Strixhaven on Arcavios. During New Phyrexia's Invasion of the Multiverse, his spark ignited, and he became a planeswalker.

Rafthrasa.name: Rafthrasa
Rafthrasa.description: '''Rafthrasa''' (or '''Rafe''' for short) was a planeswalker who wanted to live as a mortal farmer on Kartya, the island of his birth. Because he once ruled the place as god-emperor, he continued to be treated as such.

Ral Zarek.name: Ral Zarek
Ral Zarek.description: '''Ral Zarek''' (/ræl zɛrɪk/ ''RAL ZAIR-ik'') is a planeswalker native to the city plane of Ravnica and current guildmaster of the Izzet League.

Ramaz.name: Ramaz
Ramaz.description: '''Ramaz''' is a shamanic human planeswalker and crazed visionary who was responsible for manipulating Chandra Nalaar into stealing the Dragon Scroll, which eventually led to the rise of the Eldrazi on Zendikar.
planes: Magic 2014/Duels of the Planeswalkers|Duels of the Planeswalkers: 2014

Ravidel.name: Ravidel
Ravidel.description: '''Ravidel''' (RAV-ih-dell), called "'''the Battlemage'''", "'''the Journeying Angel'''", "'''Breaker of Lands'''", and "'''Collector of Lives'''" was a crazed, wicked and powerful planeswalker from an unknown plane. He initiated the Planeswalker War.
planes: Ice Age on the World of Magic: The Gathering
Sages of Minorad|Many of the world's greatest wise people

biographical_info.birthplace: An unnamed destroyed plane inside the Shard of the Twelve Worlds|Shard.

Ravi Sengir.name: Ravi Sengir
Ravi Sengir.description: '''Ravi''', now better known as '''Grandmother Ravi Sengir''', is a former planeswalker and the adopted grandmother of Baron Sengir, on Ulgrotha. During the New Phyrexia's Invasion of the Multiverse she defended Ulgrotha.

Rowan Kenrith.name: Rowan Kenrith
Rowan Kenrith.description: '''Rowan Kenrith''' is a former planeswalker from Eldraine, who specializes in electrical magic. She is the twin sister of High King Will Kenrith. He and their friends sometimes affectionately call her '''Ro'''. Her other siblings are Erec and Hazel, her father was High King Algenus Kenrith, and her stepmother was Queen Linden. Through her biological mother, she is the niece of the witches Agatha, Eriette, and Hylda. She and her brother lost their shared spark as a result of the Great Pruning.

Saheeli Rai.name: Saheeli Rai
Saheeli Rai.description: '''Saheeli Rai''' is an Avishkari human. She is a brilliant inventor who specializes in creating lifelike animated constructs as beautiful as they are deadly. She is also a former planeswalker, and currently resides on Ixalan. She is the romantic partner of Huatli.

Sandruu.name: Sandruu
Sandruu.description: '''Sandruu''' was an Anaba minotaur and planeswalker from Ulgrotha, and a good friend of Feroz, who helped him ascend.

Sarkhan Vol.name: Sarkhan Vol
Sarkhan Vol.description: '''Sarkhan Vol''' is a human former planeswalker hailing from Tarkir, a plane scourged by war. He is fascinated by dragons, something that has been a blessing and curse to him throughout his life. Originally from an alternative timeline that never happened, he was in many ways responsible for the rise of the dragonlords and their broods. He returned to Tarkir to combat the Phyrexian invaders, leveraging his draconic powers to slow their assault. The loss of his spark in the aftermath of the inva...

Sifa Grent.name: Sifa Grent
Sifa Grent.description: '''Sifa Grent''' was a human planeswalker from Grixis and the archenemy of Dack Fayden. She was the main antagonist of the comic series by IDW Publishing.

Sivitri Scarzam.name: Sivitri Scarzam
Sivitri Scarzam.description: '''Sivitri Scarzam''' was a human Planeswalker who commanded the mighty Scarzam dragons named for her. There used to be some question as to whether she or her dragons were the ones with the power to planeswalk, but that has been cleared up with the release of her planeswalker card in ''Dominaria United''.

Slobad.name: Slobad
Slobad.description: '''Slobad''' was a Mirran goblin with an unusual affinity with artifacts and an even stranger way of speaking. He was reanimated into a Phyrexian as of the Second Phyrexian Invasion of Dominaria and ''Phyrexia: All Will Be One''.

Sorin Markov.name: Sorin Markov
Sorin Markov.description: '''Sorin Markov''' is a vampire planeswalker and a master of sangromancy, a dark corner of black mana specialization.

Sylvene.name: Sylvene
Sylvene.description: '''Sylvene''' was a Ravnican planeswalker that was introduced in the lore accompanying ''Dungeons & Dragons: Adventures in the Forgotten Realms''. She was the grandmother of Tyreus.
planes: artificial plane|small demiplane of her creation
Dungeons & Dragons: Adventures in the Forgotten Realms

Taishiar.name: Taishiar
Taishiar.description: '''Taishiar''' was a planeswalker, a recorder, and a far-seer, and servant to Mezlok

Teferi Akosa.name: Teferi Akosa
Teferi Akosa.description: Mabutho (grandson) Mabutho (grandfather) '''Teferi Akosa''' He is considered the '''Father of Zhalfir''', although his later phasing of the kingdom earned him the nickname '''Destroyer of Zhalfir'''.
planes: File:Teferi Who Slows the Sunset.jpg|left|thumb|262x262px|Teferi goes to Innistrad

Tempé.name: Tempé
Tempé.description: '''Tempé''' was a planeswalker who marooned her sangrazul servant Malvos on the plane of Cridhe and indirectly caused a Dark Age on that plane.

Tessebik.name: Tessebik
Tessebik.description: '''Tessebik''' was a planeswalker from Dominaria who ascended when the Mending occurred. Tessebik is a cool-headed person, who is hesitant to take risks.

Tevesh Szat.name: Tevesh Szat
Tevesh Szat.description: '''Tevesh Szat''' (TEV-esh ZOT), the ''Doom of Fools'', born '''Tev Loneglade''', was a human planeswalker from Dominaria with a draconic form and one of the Nine Titans, a group of nine planeswalkers led by Urza in the defense of Dominaria.
planes: Ice Age on the World of Magic: The Gathering
Formation of the Shard of Twelve Worlds
Fallen Empires on the World of Magic: The Gathering

Teyo Verada.name: Teyo Verada
Teyo Verada.description: '''Teyo Verada''' is a human planeswalker shieldmage, or geometrist, from the plane Gobakhan.

The Adventurer.name: The Adventurer
The Adventurer.description: '''The Adventurer''' is a selectable avatar in Magic: The Gathering Arena. In the tutorial stages of Arena, they encounter and fight various characters, including the Elder Dragon Nicol Bolas.

The Thorn.name: The Thorn
The Thorn.description: '''The Thorn''' was a planeswalker and the main foe of Tempé, who fears him.

The Traveler.name: The Traveler
The Traveler.description: '''The Traveler''', also known in Tazeem as the '''Outsider'''

The Unluckiest.name: The Unluckiest
The Unluckiest.description: '''The Unluckiest''' is an unnamed planeswalker from an undefined plane, who is cursed with bad luck.

The Wanderer.name: The Wanderer
The Wanderer.description: '''The Wanderer''' is a former planeswalker introduced in ''War of the Spark''. She is the current '''Emperor of Kamigawa''', and one of the most efficient and deadly warriors seen on any plane. She lost her spark during the Desparkening, but unlike her fellow planeswalkers, this was a great benefit to her.

Thomil.name: Thomil
Thomil.description: '''Thomil''' was a planeswalker first mentioned in the ''Alpha'' rulebook, and also featured in ''Roreca's Tale''.

Tyreus.name: Tyreus
Tyreus.description: '''Tyreus''' is a Ravnican planeswalker that was introduced in the lore accompanying ''Dungeons & Dragons: Adventures in the Forgotten Realms''. He is the grandson of Sylvene.
planes: Dungeons & Dragons: Adventures in the Forgotten Realms
artificial plane|small demiplane of her creation

Tyvar Kell.name: Tyvar Kell
Tyvar Kell.description: '''Tyvar Kell''', Prince of Kaldheim, The younger brother of King Harald, uniter of Kaldheim's two groups of elves, Tyvar is a confident, charismatic, and pale-skinned wood elf. He is short and sports a muscular frame and long, braided auburn hair. He rarely wears a shirt, exposing his powerful physique and distinctive tattoos of Koma, the "cosmos serpent" of Kaldheim, whom all elves possess a shared reverence for. The tattoo's twin dagger shapes and the double-bladed sword he fights with each r...

Vaash Vroga.name: Vaash Vroga
Vaash Vroga.description: '''Vaash Vroga''', called the '''Orphan of Urborg''', is a Dominarian planeswalker that was introduced in ''Magic: Legends''.

Valdusian Tomer.name: Valdusian Tomer
Valdusian Tomer.description: '''Valdusian Tomer''' was a good planeswalker. During the Great Magus War on Antausia, Valdusian was an apprentice to Ignatius Firestorm. Together, they challenged the evil sorceress Dinitra La Croix for control of the Beldingard power pools, which they took easily.

Vivien Reid.name: Vivien Reid
Vivien Reid.description: '''Vivien Reid''', named the '''Queen of Ghosts''' on Ixalan,

Vram.name: Vram
Vram.description: '''Vram''' was a planeswalker who put her daughter Mao under the wing of the naturalist Peter Langwynd.

Will Kenrith.name: Will Kenrith
Will Kenrith.description: '''Will Kenrith''' is a former planeswalker who specializes in ice magic, and the curren...

Worzel.name: Worzel
Worzel.description: '''Worzel''' was a planeswalker first mentioned in the ''Alpha'' rulebook.

Yawden.name: Yawden
Yawden.description: '''Yawden''' was the nemesis of the planeswalker Arzakon, who attacked Shandalar.

God.name: God
God.description: as of ''Aetherdrift'' Although gods and deities have been part of ''Magic'' for a long time, a special '''God''' creature type had to be introduced for the Greek-inspired Theros block The word "god" is used gender neutrally, meaning it can signify a male or female.

List of gods and deities.name: List of gods and deities
List of gods and deities.description: This is a '''list of all gods and deities''', or creatures that are worshiped as such, mentioned in the ''Magic'' storyline.
planes: Dungeons & Dragons: Adventures in the Forgotten Realms/Trivia|Asmodeus

Anyxni.name: Anyxni
Anyxni.description: '''Anyxni''' was one of Shanna's crew on the Weatherlight prior to its Compleation.

Arvad.name: Arvad
Arvad.description: '''Arvad''' is a vampire, who once was a Benalish knight. He became security chief of Jhoira's crew on the rebuilt Skyship ''Weatherlight''.

Botono.name: Botono
Botono.description: '''Botono''' was one of Shanna's crew on the Weatherlight prior to its Compleation.

Crovax.name: Crovax
Crovax.description: '''Crovax''', sometimes known as Crovax the Cursed and later as the Ascendant Evincar of Rath, was once an aristocratic human from Urborg born as part of Urza's Bloodline Project. Throughout his life, he was the victim of Phyrexian attempts to drive him mad and turn him against Urza. These were ultimately successful and resulted in him going from a loyal member of the ''Weatherlight'' crew to one of their deadliest enemies.

Elmegraun.name: Elmegraun
Elmegraun.description: '''Elmegraun''' was one of Shanna's crew on the Weatherlight prior to its Compleation.

Ertai.name: Ertai
Ertai.description: '''Ertai''' was a talented, arrogant young wizard from Tolaria who signed on to be the Skyship ''Weatherlight'''s mage. He was resurrected during the second Phyrexian invasion of Dominaria.

biographical_info.lifetime: War with Phyrexia and Mending Era-present

Gerrard Capashen.name: Gerrard Capashen
Gerrard Capashen.description: '''Gerrard Capashen''' is the protagonist of The Weatherlight Saga, the epic ''Magic'' storyline beginning with the Weatherlight expansion and continuing through Apocalypse.

Hanna.name: Hanna
Hanna.description: '''Hanna''' was the blonde, and often grease stained, human navigator and engineer of the ''Skyship Weatherlight''. She was born on Tolaria (Dominaria).

Jhoira.name: Jhoira
Jhoira.description: '''Jhoira''' (JOY-ruh) is a nearly immortal Shivan artificer of the Ghitu tribe who studied at the Tolarian Academy on Dominaria.

Karn.name: Karn
Karn.description: '''Karn''' is a time-travelling silver golem from Dominaria. As the unwilling leader of New Phyrexia, he was called '''Father of Machines''' and later '''False Patriarch'''. Twice he became a planeswalker, having inherited the sparks of Urza and then Venser, but both times he eventually sacrificed his spark for the greater good.

Mirri.name: Mirri
Mirri.description: '''Mirri''' was a cat warrior, a crew-member aboard the skyship ''Weatherlight'', and Gerrard's best friend.

Multani.name: Multani
Multani.description: '''Multani''' is the Maro-Sorcerer of the sentient Yavimaya forest of Dominaria. Multani punished Urza for destroying Argoth and killing fellow nature spirit Titania, before allying with him against the Phyrexians and providing the Weatherseed that became the hull of the Skyship ''Weatherlight''. Multani also later taught Gerrard, Mirri, and Rofellos, before preparing Yavimaya for the Phyrexian Invasion. During the invasion itself, he dissipated all his power to move a section of Yavimaya to the...

Orim.name: Orim
Orim.description: '''Orim''' was one of the core members of the ''Weatherlight'' crew, performing numerous duties on the ship.

Rafwyn Capashen.name: Rafwyn Capashen
Rafwyn Capashen.description: '''Rafwyn "Raff" Capashen''' is a distant relative of Captain Gerrard Capashen. He became the ship's mage of Jhoira's crew on the rebuilt Skyship ''Weatherlight''.

Rofellos.name: Rofellos
Rofellos.description: '''Rofellos''' was an elf from Llanowar that was best known for his time aboard the Skyship Weatherlight.

Shanna Sisay.name: Shanna Sisay
Shanna Sisay.description: '''Shanna Sisay''' is a descendant of Captain Sisay. She became part of Jhoira's crew, and later captain, of the rebuilt Skyship ''Weatherlight''.

Sisay.name: Sisay
Sisay.description: Captain '''Sisay''' (siss-say) was the Zhalfirin captain of the skyship ''Weatherlight'' and an important figure in the Weatherlight Saga.[http://www.wizards.com/magic/expert/Mirage/Character_Profile...

Slimefoot.name: Slimefoot
Slimefoot.description: '''Slimefoot''' is a Thallid which grew out of a small spore attached to the hull of the reconstructed skyship ''Weatherlight'' on Dominaria. As such it became an unofficial member of Captain Jhoira's crew.

Squee.name: Squee
Squee.description: '''Squee''' is a formerly immortal goblin from Dominaria. He was a cabin-hand on the ''Skyship Weatherlight'' and the king of a goblin clan for a time.

Starke il-Vec.name: Starke il-Vec
Starke il-Vec.description: '''Starke ''il''-Vec''' was an outcast of the Vec tribe and a duplicitous member of the Skyship ''Weatherlight'' crew that served as their guide on their journey to Rath.

Tahngarth.name: Tahngarth
Tahngarth.description: '''Tahngarth''' was a proud minotaur warrior from Talruum and the first mate aboard the skyship ''Weatherlight''.

Tiana.name: Tiana
Tiana.description: '''Tiana''' is a timid Serra Angel artificer from Dominaria, who has become the guardian and chief engineer of the new Skyship ''Weatherlight'' as part of Jhoira's crew. She has a natural affinity with the ship and inherent knowledge of its workings.

Ulaten.name: Ulaten
Ulaten.description: '''Ulaten''' was one of Shanna's crew on the Weatherlight prior to its Compleation.

Velena.name: Velena
Velena.description: '''Velena''' was one of Shanna's crew on the Weatherlight prior to its Compleation.

Weatherlight crew.name: Weatherlight crew
Weatherlight crew.description: Over the years the skyship ''Weatherlight'' had many crewmembers, but when someone refers to '''the ''Weatherlight'' crew''' it usually means Gerrard Capashen and his companions, who were the heroes of the Magic storyline from ''Weatherlight'' up to ''Apocalypse''. After salvaging the remains of the ''Weatherlight'', Jhoira set out to assemble a new crew to fight against Belzenlok's Cabal in the current era. This article is a list of all characters that manned the ''Weatherlight'' over the years...

Andrios.name: Andrios
Andrios.description: '''Andrios''', ''Roaming Explorer'', is an artifact creature wizard from an unknown plane.

Arteeoh.name: Arteeoh
Arteeoh.description: '''Arteeoh''', ''Dread Scavenger'', is a legendary robot from Myra the Magnificent's Intergalactic Astrotorium of Fun.

biographical_info.birthplace: Myra the Magnificent's Intergalactic Astrotorium of Fun

Byode.name: Byode
Byode.description: '''Byode''' is a planeswalker of an unspecified species, who can travel between separate Universes rather than planes. Due to this they are called a Universewalker. They are black/blue aligned.

Champions of Archery.name: Champions of Archery
Champions of Archery.description: The '''Champions of Archery''' are a legendary group of human archers from Eldraine.

Cinematic Phoenix.name: Cinematic Phoenix
Cinematic Phoenix.description: The '''Cinematic Phoenix''' is a legendary phoenix from an unknown plane.

Dungeon Master.name: Dungeon Master
Dungeon Master.description: The '''Dungeon Master''' is a white-haired dwarfish planeswalker wizard who is known for assembling adventure parties. He is white/blue aligned.

Elusen.name: Elusen
Elusen.description: '''Elusen''' is an angel advisor from an unknown plane.

Ersta.name: Ersta
Ersta.description: '''Ersta''' is a planeswalker unicorn, who is friendly to wizards. They are multicolor aligned.

Euroakus.name: Euroakus
Euroakus.description: '''Euroakus''' is a legendary treefolk wizard from an Earth-like plane.

Inzerva.name: Inzerva
Inzerva.description: '''Inzerva''', known as the ''Master of Insights'', is a blue/red aligned draconic planeswalker who gathers knowledge and jealously hordes secrets.

Keeper of the Secret Lair.name: Keeper of the Secret Lair
Keeper of the Secret Lair.description: The '''Keeper of the Secret Lair''' is a legendary merfolk rogue from an unknown plane.

Kharis.name: Kharis
Kharis.description: '''Kharis''' is a dragon wizard from an unknown plane that was seen through the Eyes of a Beholder.

M'Odo.name: M'Odo
M'Odo.description: '''M'Odo''', ''the Gnarled Oracle'', is a zombie elf wizard from an unknown plane.

Myntasha.name: Myntasha
Myntasha.description: '''Myntasha''', ''Honored One'', is a legendary snow elk from an unknown plane.

Nira (Duel Masters).name: Nira (Duel Masters)
Nira (Duel Masters).description: '''Nira''', the ''Hellkite Duelist'', is a dragon from an unknown plane.

Sol.name: Sol
Sol.description: '''Sol''', ''Advocate Eternal'', is a dragon angel from an unknown plane.

Svega.name: Svega
Svega.description: '''Svega''' is a green/white/blue aligned planeswalker who brings planeswalkers and non-planeswalkers together through unconventional means.

Treizeci.name: Treizeci
Treizeci.description: '''Treizeci''' is a human knight from an unknown plane who cares for Nostalgia.

Accountant.name: Accountant
Accountant.description: '''Accountant''' is an unreleased acorn creature class for those who keep, inspect, and analyse financial accounts.

Aladdin.name: Aladdin
Aladdin.description: '''Aladdin''' was a rogue from Rabiah, famous for his lamp and his ring, and his artifact-thieving skills. Aladdin's destructive ring was gifted by a magician, who told him it was a formidable talisman against evil, as long as Aladdin kept obeying the magician. Aladdin's lamp, a relic of legend, allowed its bearer to shape destiny, turning uncertainty into opportunity, much like the fabled wishes of old.

Alchemist.name: Alchemist
Alchemist.description: '''Alchemist''' is a obsolete creature class. Alchemists are people who practice alchemy, a form of chemistry and speculative philosophy which is concerned with discovering methods for transmuting base metals into gold and with finding a Universal Solvent, an Elixir of Immortality, and a Panacea.

Ali Baba.name: Ali Baba
Ali Baba.description: '''Ali Baba''' was a cunning rogue from Rabiah Ali Baba, a master of unlocking secrets and breaching defenses that others deemed impenetrable. With a simple utterance of ''"Open, Sesame!"'', he could cause the most formidable barriers to yield, revealing the hidden treasures and mysteries beyond.

Armored.name: Armored
Armored.description: as of ''Mystery Booster 2'' '''Armored''' is a test card-only creature class used to represent those who are covered with a special material that protects against weapons in some form.

Army.name: Army
Army.description: as of ''Modern Horizons III'' '''Army''' is a black token-only creature class introduced in ''War of the Spark'', intrinsically tied with the Amass keyword action. Originally, it was only combined with Zombie, as in Zombie Army. Later, Armies of other creatures were created.

Artist (creature type).name: Artist (creature type)
Artist (creature type).description: as of ''2024 Amsterdam Unknown Event'' '''Artist''' is a test card-only creature class used to represent those who create art. It does not appear on a Type line but instead as part of an Activated ability that temporarily changes the type of a card.

Athlete.name: Athlete
Athlete.description: as of ''Mystery Booster 2'' '''Athlete''' is a test card-only creature class used to represent those who compete in athletic sports.

Attendee.name: Attendee
Attendee.description: as of ''Heroes of the Realm'' '''Attendee''' is a token-only acorn creature class used to represent convention go-ers at MagicCons.

Avenger (creature type).name: Avenger (creature type)
Avenger (creature type).description: '''Avenger''' is an obsolete creature type used to represent a Class of people who inflict vengeance in response to something bad that has occurred to them or something they cared about.

Bodyguard.name: Bodyguard
Bodyguard.description: '''Bodyguard''' is an obsolete creature class. A bodyguard is a person or group of persons employed to guard an individual, often a high official or VIP, from bodily harm.

Boxer.name: Boxer
Boxer.description: as of ''2024 Amsterdam Unknown Event'' '''Boxer''' is a test card-only creature class used to represent those who participate in the sport or fighting style of boxing.

Bureaucrat.name: Bureaucrat
Bureaucrat.description: as of ''Unsanctioned'' '''Bureaucrat''' is an acorn and obsolete creature class used for cards that depict an official in a company or government.

Champion (creature type).name: Champion (creature type)
Champion (creature type).description: as of ''Mystery Booster 2'' '''Champion''' is a test card-only creature class used to represent those who fight for a cause or on behalf of someone else.

Chef.name: Chef
Chef.description: as of ''2024 Amsterdam Unknown Event'' '''Chef''' is a test card-only creature class used to represent those who work as a professional cook.

Child.name: Child
Child.description: as of ''Unfinity'' '''Child''' is a creature class used for cards which depict a young creature. It was an acorn type until ''Unfinity'' which introduced it on an eternal legal card.

Clown.name: Clown
Clown.description: as of ''Duskmourn: House of Horror'' '''Clown''' is a creature class introduced for ''Unfinity''. While initially largely acorn-stamped, the type appeared on eternal legal cards as well before debuting in a premier set with the release of ''Duskmourn: House of Horror''.

Creature class.name: Creature class
Creature class.description: '''Creature class''', often shortened to just '''Class''', is an R&D term for a subset of the characteristic "creature type".

Deserter.name: Deserter
Deserter.description: '''Deserter''' is a seldom used creature subtype which only appears on tokens.

Designer.name: Designer
Designer.description: as of ''Unsanctioned'' '''Designer''' is a silver-bordered creature class used for cards that depict a person who plans the workings of something prior to it being made.

Drone.name: Drone
Drone.description: as of ''Phyrexia: All Will Be One'' '''Drone''' is creature type that refers to simple, immature, or artificial lifeforms that perform tedious and menial work.

Egg.name: Egg
Egg.description: as of ''The Lost Caverns of Ixalan'' '''Egg''' is a creature type used for cards that depict the developing embryo stage of a bird, reptile, fish or invertebrate as an oval or round object with a chalky shell or leathery membrane. When used on creature cards they regularly turn into another creature when a certain condition is met. When eggs are depicted on artifact cards this is not always the case.

Elder Dragon Legend.name: Elder Dragon Legend
Elder Dragon Legend.description: '''Elder Dragon Legend''' is an obsolete creature subtype for cards that represented legendary elder dragons.

El-Hajjâj.name: El-Hajjâj
El-Hajjâj.description: '''El-Hajjâj''' (EL ha-JAJ) was a powerful wizard from Rabiah, and possibly one of the few people not copied in the Thousand-fold Refraction.

Elves (creature type).name: Elves (creature type)
Elves (creature type).description: as of ''Unsanctioned'' '''Elves''' is an acorn creature type for elves that impersonate Elvis

Enchantress.name: Enchantress
Enchantress.description: '''Enchantress''' is an obsolete creature subtype, and a slang term used by ''Magic'' R&D to describe the connected ability. An enchantress is a person, often an attractive woman, who is skilled at magic and able to easily charm others.

Fan.name: Fan
Fan.description: as of 2024 Las Vegas ''Planechase Unknown'' '''Fan''' is a test card-only creature class used to represent creatures that exhibit strong interest or admiration for something or somebody.

Fighter.name: Fighter
Fighter.description: as of ''Heroes of the Realm'' '''Fighter''' is a token-only acorn creature class, used for adventurers that are masters of combat as seen in a traditional ''Dungeons & Dragons'' party.

Flagbearer.name: Flagbearer
Flagbearer.description: as of ''Apocalypse'' '''Flagbearer''' is a creature class for cards that depict soldiers or civilians who bear a standard or Orcish Oriflamme, i.e. either a type of flag or an inflexible but mobile image, which is used as a formal, visual symbol of a military unit on the battlefield.

General (creature type).name: General (creature type)
General (creature type).description: '''General''' is an obsolete creature subtype for a high ranking commander of an army.

Goblin King.name: Goblin King
Goblin King.description: '''Goblin King''' is an obsolete creature subtype for cards that represented kings of the goblins.

Grandchild.name: Grandchild
Grandchild.description: as of ''Unsanctioned'' '''Grandchild''' is a unique acorn creature class used for cards which depict the child of a child of another creature.

Guardian.name: Guardian
Guardian.description: '''Guardian''' is an obsolete creature class for creatures that guard, protect, or preserve.

Half.name: Half
Half.description: '''Half''' is a unique creature type used for a test card that creates creature tokens that have been cut through into two pieces.

Harlequin.name: Harlequin
Harlequin.description: '''Harlequin''' is an obsolete creature type used to represent a Class of people who act as a pantomime jester or clown, typically dressed in colorful checkered clothes.

Hatificer.name: Hatificer
Hatificer.description: as of ''Unfinity'' '''Hatificer''' is a acorn creature class of those that create and fight with magical or technological hats.

Head.name: Head
Head.description: A '''Head''' is a creature class representing a head of a creature acting independently. It was introduced first in a Challenge Deck for a Hydra which has many heads and later also became an acorn type for a Zombie which can live as a head.

Hero.name: Hero
Hero.description: as of ''Marvel's Deadpool thumb|right|200 px| was the only Hero in ''Magic: The Gathering'' for 20 years after the Grand Creature Type Update.

Judge (creature type).name: Judge (creature type)
Judge (creature type).description: as of ''2024 Amsterdam Unknown Event'' '''Judge''' is a test card-only creature class used to represent those who hear, determine, and/or preside over legal matters.

King.name: King
King.description: '''King''' is an obsolete creature subtype for male monarchs who rule over a kingdom.

Lady of Proper Etiquette.name: Lady of Proper Etiquette
Lady of Proper Etiquette.description: as of ''Unglued'' '''Lady of Proper Etiquette''' is an acorn creature class for ladies who have proper etiquette.

Legend.name: Legend
Legend.description: '''Legend''' is an obsolete creature type. Only one creature of the same name, with this creature type, could be in play at the same time. For a while, they were even on the restricted list, meaning there could be only one creature of the same name in each deck. It was one of two subtypes with rules baggage, alongside Walls.

Lord.name: Lord
Lord.description: '''Lord''' is an obsolete creature type for creatures with an occupation of high class or power within a structure or organization. Noble is currently used for the same purpose. In contemporary parlance, "lord" is shorthand for a creature that gives a benefit to a class of other creatures, be it a type, subtype or keyword ability.

Mime.name: Mime
Mime.description: as of ''Unfinity'' '''Mime''' is an acorn creature class for a type of performer who pantomime.

Monger.name: Monger
Monger.description: as of ''Mercadian Masques'' '''Monger''' is a creature class unique to ''Mercadian Masques''. The five creatures of the cycle are depicted as strange-looking dealers in commodities. Each of these uncommon 3/3 creatures has a cost of and one colored mana, and has activated abilities costing that any player (not just the controller) can play.

Mystic.name: Mystic
Mystic.description: as of ''Odyssey'' '''Mystic''' is a semi-retired creature class. Mystics, like clerics, are adept at channeling mana with their faith, but instead of devoting themselves to a religion, they learn magic through careful meditation. Mystics often have a special connection with the spirits of the deceased, granting them powers such as flight.

Niall Silvain.name: Niall Silvain
Niall Silvain.description: '''Niall Silvain''' was an ouphe from Terisiare during the Dark Age of Dominaria.

Paratrooper.name: Paratrooper
Paratrooper.description: as of ''Unhinged'' '''Paratrooper''' is an acorn creature class, used for soldiers that are trained to attack or land in combat areas by parachuting from airplanes.

Pixie Queen.name: Pixie Queen
Pixie Queen.description: '''Pixie Queen''' is an obsolete creature subtype for cards that represented queens of the pixies.

Processor.name: Processor
Processor.description: as of ''Battle for Zendikar'' '''Processor''' is a creature class exclusive to Eldrazi and is associated with Ulamog's brood. It was introduced alongside Scion in ''Battle for Zendikar''.

Rag Man.name: Rag Man
Rag Man.description: The '''Rag Man''' was a minion created by Lord Ith during The Dark Age on Dominaria.

Reveler.name: Reveler
Reveler.description: '''Reveler''' is a creature class for creatures who are partying or celebrating. It was introduced in the ''Defeat a God'' Challenge Deck from the Theros block and is not legal in a regular ''Magic'' game.

Rigger.name: Rigger
Rigger.description: as of ''Unsanctioned'' '''Rigger''' is a creature class. Riggers are creatures that specialize in the lifting and moving of extremely large or heavy objects.

Sage.name: Sage
Sage.description: '''Sage''' is an obsolete creature class representing someone who has, shown, or indicated profound wisdom regarding magic or some other subject of knowledge.

Scientist.name: Scientist
Scientist.description: as of ''Fallout'' '''Scientist''' is a creature class for those who work in laboratories and who systematically gather and use research and evidence to make hypotheses. They do experiments to test them and to advance knowledge.

Scion.name: Scion
Scion.description: '''Scion''' is creature type exclusive to Eldrazi tokens. It was introduced alongside Processor in ''Battle for Zendikar'' and means "descendant".

Serf.name: Serf
Serf.description: '''Serf''' is a unique creature class which only appears on tokens that represents people in a feudalistic systems who are bound in serfdom.

Sindbad.name: Sindbad
Sindbad.description: '''Sindbad''' was a famous human explorer from Rabiah, who once used a giant flying bird as a means of transportation, tying himself fast to one of its enormous claws.

Smith.name: Smith
Smith.description: '''Smith''' is a obsolete creature class. Smiths are craftspeople who fashion useful items (for example, tools, jewelry, armor, and weapons) out of various metals.

Spawn.name: Spawn
Spawn.description: as of ''Modern Horizons 3'' '''Spawn''' is a blue and colorless creature type used for cards and tokens that depict any creature that is regarded as the offspring of some concept, place, character or creature.

Spellcaster.name: Spellcaster
Spellcaster.description: A '''spellcaster''' is one of the five main creature classes which can cast spells. The division into five classes was completed with the introduction of warlock in ''Throne of Eldraine'' and fully implemented in ''Strixhaven: School of Mages''.

Stained.name: Stained
Stained.description: as of ''2023 Barcelona Unknown Event'' '''Stained''' is a test card-only and token-only artifact creature type used to represent artifact creatures that have a discoloration that can be clearly distinguished from the surface, material, or medium it is found upon. Thus far it has always been combined with the Glass type.

Teacher.name: Teacher
Teacher.description: '''Teacher''' is an unreleased acorn creature class for those who impart their knowledge on others.

Tentacle.name: Tentacle
Tentacle.description: '''Tentacle''' is a token-only creature type introduced in ''Theros Beyond Death''. It is used for cards that depict flexible limbs or appendages from a Kraken (e.g. Nadir Kraken). Tentacles are used for grasping or moving about.

Torturer.name: Torturer
Torturer.description: '''Torturer''' is an unreleased acorn creature class for those who inflict pain on someone as a punishment or to force them to do or say something.

Townsfolk.name: Townsfolk
Townsfolk.description: '''Townsfolk''' is an obsolete creature class for Humans with no specific occupation.

Waiter.name: Waiter
Waiter.description: as of ''Unglued'' '''Waiter''' is an acorn creature class for restaurant workers and other related professions who serve food.

Witch.name: Witch
Witch.description: '''Witch''' is an obsolete creature type that originally appeared on the card .

Wrestler.name: Wrestler
Wrestler.description: as of ''Unstable'' '''Wrestler''' is an acorn creature class for those who fight in a way that involves grappling with their opponent in an attempt to force or toss them to the ground.

Abomination.name: Abomination
Abomination.description: '''Abomination''' is an obsolete creature subtype representing creatures that are considered unnatural and whose very existence causes disgust and/or hatred.

Alicorn.name: Alicorn
Alicorn.description: as of ''Ponies: The Galloping'' '''Alicorn''' is an acorn creature type representing a race of flying Unicorns. It is a crossover type from the ''My Little Pony'' franchise.

Anemone.name: Anemone
Anemone.description: '''Anemone''' is an obsolete creature subtype which only appeared in errata for a short time following the Grand Creature Type Update to represent sea anemone but was later made obsolete in a subsequent rules update to be Jellyfish instead.

Antelope.name: Antelope
Antelope.description: as of ''Ikoria: Lair of Behemoths'' '''Antelope''' is a rarely used creature type used for cards that depict various swift-running ruminant mammals having long horns and a slender build. The first creature to bear the type was Graceful Antelope in ''Odyssey'' (though Stampeding Wildebeests from ''Visions'' was issued errata during the Grand Creature Type Update to become antelope as well).

Art (creature type).name: Art (creature type)
Art (creature type).description: as of ''Unsanctioned'' '''Art''' is a silver-bordered creature type used for cards which depict a creature of living art created by an artist.

Aurochs.name: Aurochs
Aurochs.description: as of ''Coldsnap'' '''Aurochs''' is a seldom used green creature type connected to the Ice Age of Dominaria. The aurochs are the extinct ancestor of domestic cattle, far larger than most modern cattle with a shoulder height of 2 metres (6.6 ft) and weight of 1,000 kilograms. On the cards, each Aurochs has trample and "Whenever ~ attacks, it gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each other attacking Aurochs".

Autobot.name: Autobot
Autobot.description: '''Autobot''' is an acorn creature type for a race of sentient mechanical self-configuring modular robotic lifeforms. It is a crossover type from the ''Tranformers'' franchise.

Badger.name: Badger
Badger.description: as of ''Bloomburrow'' '''Badger''' is a green or red creature type for cards that depict lifelike short-legged, heavy-set digging omnivores.

Balloon.name: Balloon
Balloon.description: as of ''Unfinity'' '''Balloon''' is a token creature subtype for the prizes given out at attractions.

Banshee.name: Banshee
Banshee.description: '''Banshee''' is an obsolete creature subtype for cards that represented a type of female spirit that heralds death by screaming.

Barishi.name: Barishi
Barishi.description: '''Barishi''' is an obsolete creature subtype for cards that represented a type of plant elemental bovine.

Basilisk.name: Basilisk
Basilisk.description: as of ''Phyrexia: All Will Be One'' '''Basilisk''' is a creature type describing giant, many-legged reptiles that can turn their enemies to stone with their gaze.

Beholder.name: Beholder
Beholder.description: as of ''Commander Legends: Battle for Baldur's Gate''
planes: Dungeons & Dragons: Adventures in the Forgotten Realms

Bringer.name: Bringer
Bringer.description: as of ''Fifth Dawn'' '''Bringer''' is a creature type unique to ''Fifth Dawn''. They are depicted as crystalline humanoid or beastly entities. Their nature transcends the metal ecology of Mirrodin.

Brushwagg.name: Brushwagg
Brushwagg.description: as of ''Modern Horizons 3'' '''Brushwagg''' is a green creature type that was first used in black border for the card Brushwagg in ''Mirage''.

Butterfly.name: Butterfly
Butterfly.description: '''Butterfly''' is an obsolete creature subtype which originally only appeared on tokens.

Camarid.name: Camarid
Camarid.description: '''Camarid''' is a seldom used token-specific creature type.

Camel.name: Camel
Camel.description: as of ''Modern Horizons 2'' '''Camel''' is a rarely-used creature type. Camels are commonly white or green.

Caribou.name: Caribou
Caribou.description: '''Caribou''' is a seldom used creature subtype that represents a large deer native to the arctic, subarctic, tundra, boreal, and mountainous regions.

Carrier.name: Carrier
Carrier.description: as of ''Modern Horizons'' '''Carrier''' is creature type originally unique to ''Urza's Legacy''. It first existed as a vertical cycle of four black Phyrexian creatures which spread disease. Otherwise, they could have been just Horrors.

Characteristic and iconic races.name: Characteristic and iconic races
Characteristic and iconic races.description: Each color in ''Magic: The Gathering'' has '''characteristic and iconic''' creature types.

Cheetah.name: Cheetah
Cheetah.description: '''Cheetah''' is an obsolete creature subtype which represented an order of large cat known for being extremely fast.

Chicken.name: Chicken
Chicken.description: as of ''Unsanctioned'' '''Chicken''' is an obsolete silver-bordered creature type and current celebration card creature type used for cards which depict a type of domesticated fowl.

Cockatrice.name: Cockatrice
Cockatrice.description: as of ''Journey into Nyx'' '''Cockatrice''' was originally a green creature type that was only used once, for the card Cockatrice in ''Alpha''. Cockatrices are flying creatures that can turn their enemies to stone, much like Basilisks. They have lithe, feathery, serpentine bodies with the head of a bird, two legs, and two wings. They are the size of a large horse.

Cow.name: Cow
Cow.description: as of ''Mystery Booster 2'' '''Cow''' is a seldom used acorn and test card creature type for cards which depict a type of large, domestic bovine.

Cyborg.name: Cyborg
Cyborg.description: as of ''Unsanctioned'' '''Cyborg''' is a silver-bordered creature type used for cards that depict persons whose physical abilities are extended beyond normal human limitations by mechanical elements built into the body.

Dauthi.name: Dauthi
Dauthi.description: as of ''Modern Horizons 2'' '''Dauthi''' is a black creature type used for cards that depict an insane Horror-like race of beings trapped in the Shadows of Rath. All have the keyword ability Shadow.

Deer.name: Deer
Deer.description: as of ''Unstable'' '''Deer''' is a silver-bordered creature type for cards which depict a type of hoofed herbivorous mammal.

Die (creature type).name: Die (creature type)
Die (creature type).description: '''Die''' is an acorn token creature type used for cards which depict an animated die. The dice appear as large dog sized, dotted, cubiform creatures with legs and arms which wield weapons.

Dragonfly.name: Dragonfly
Dragonfly.description: '''Dragonfly''' is an obsolete creature subtype which represented an order of flying insects with a pair of large compound eyes, two pairs large transparent wings, and an elongated body.

Elemental?.name: Elemental?
Elemental?.description: as of ''Unglued'' '''Elemental?''' is an acorn creature type for Question Elementals. It leaves some doubt on if they are actually elementals but could also just be an aspect of their existence that warps their very race into a question.

Expansion-Symbol.name: Expansion-Symbol
Expansion-Symbol.description: '''Expansion-Symbol''' is an acorn colorless token-only creature race introduced in ''Unhinged''.

Eye.name: Eye
Eye.description: as of ''Duskmourn: House of Horror'' '''Eye''' is a seldom-used black creature type used for cards that depict magical sentient beings that appear as large, floating, single eyes.
planes: Dungeons & Dragons: Adventures in the Forgotten Realms

Ferret.name: Ferret
Ferret.description: as of ''Ikoria: Lair of Behemoths'' '''Ferret''' is a unique creature type that is only used for Joven's Ferrets from ''Homelands''. A ferret is a domesticated weasel-like, often albino, mammal that is often trained to hunt rats or rabbits. It's closely related to the polecat, and sables such as the Bronze Sable.

Fiend.name: Fiend
Fiend.description: '''Fiend''' is an obsolete creature subtype for cards that represented malignant or diabolical beings.

Frostbeast.name: Frostbeast
Frostbeast.description: '''Frostbeast''' is an obsolete creature subtype for cards that represented a type of frost elemental beast.

Gargoyle.name: Gargoyle
Gargoyle.description: as of ''Murders at Karlov Manor'' '''Gargoyle''' is a creature type used for cards that depict fearsome guardian figures shaped like a winged humanoid or animal, incorporated into the architecture of a building in the form of a waterspout. Those that do not channel water are known as "grotesques". Sentient gargoyles can move from the architectural base and fly, despite their dense mineral nature. They mainly appear in white and as artifact creatures. Gargoyles almost always have flying, and some...

Germ.name: Germ
Germ.description: as of ''Alchemy: Tarkir'' '''Germ''' is an exclusively black creature type with base power and toughness of 0, which only appears on tokens.

Glass.name: Glass
Glass.description: as of ''2023 Barcelona Unknown Event'' '''Glass''' is a test card-only and token-only artifact creature type used to represent artifact creatures that are made of an often-transparent amorphous non-crystalline solid. Thus far it has always been combined with the Stained type.

Gnoll.name: Gnoll
Gnoll.description: as of ''Alchemy Horizons: Baldur's Gate'' '''Gnoll''' is a creature type introduced to ''Magic: The Gathering'' in ''Dungeons & Dragons: Adventures in the Forgotten Realms''. It was inspired by the Dungeons & Dragons .
planes: Dungeons & Dragons: Adventures in the Forgotten Realms

Goat.name: Goat
Goat.description: as of ''Duskmourn: House of Horror'' '''Goat''' is a creature type used for cards that depict various hollow-horned, bearded ruminant mammals living in mountainous areas and their domesticated relatives that are raised for wool, milk, and meat.

Gorilla.name: Gorilla
Gorilla.description: as of ''Mystery Booster'' '''Gorilla''' is an obsolete and test card token creature type for a race herbivorous, predominantly ground-dwelling great apes that inhabit tropical forests.

Graveborn.name: Graveborn
Graveborn.description: '''Graveborn''' is a seldom used creature subtype which only appears on tokens for a type of undead associated with both red and black mana.

Gus.name: Gus
Gus.description: as of ''Unglued'' '''Gus''' is a silver-bordered creature type that depicts a creature with a large head half the size of a human, large ears, fat body, two large arms, and a large mouth full of teeth. Gus debuted as a creature type in ''Unglued''.

Hamster.name: Hamster
Hamster.description: as of ''Bloomburrow Commander'' '''Hamster''' is a rarely used creature type which first appeared on tokens in ''Dungeons & Dragons: Adventures in the Forgotten Realms''. It is used for cards depicting small burrowing rodents with a stout body, relatively short ears, a short tail, and large cheek pouches for carrying food.
planes: Dungeons & Dragons: Adventures in the Forgotten Realms

Hawk.name: Hawk
Hawk.description: as of 2024 Las Vegas ''Unknown Event'' '''Hawk''' is a test card creature type for a race of birds of prey with hooked beaks and sharp talons that are smaller than most eagles. Hawks in eternal legal cards normally fall under the Bird creature type.

Hippogriff.name: Hippogriff
Hippogriff.description: as of ''Alchemy Horizons: Baldur's Gate'' '''Hippogriff''' is a mainly white creature type used for cards that depict flying creatures that resemble griffins, but have the body and hind parts of a horse instead of a cat. The front parts resemble a bird. An example is Razor Hippogriff from ''Scars of Mirrodin''.

Jaguar.name: Jaguar
Jaguar.description: '''Jaguar''' is a digital and promotional only creature type for a race of large heavily built cats with a yellowish-brown coat with black spots. Jaguars in eternal legal cards normally fall under the Cat creature type.

Jellyfish.name: Jellyfish
Jellyfish.description: as of ''Foundations Jumpstart'' '''Jellyfish''' is a primarily blue creature type used for cards depicting transparent free-swimming (or flying) bell-shaped creatures with tentacles and stingers. Note that jellyfish, which are invertebrates and don't have gills, are not fish.

Kangaroo.name: Kangaroo
Kangaroo.description: as of ''Unstable'' '''Kangaroo''' is an acorn creature type for cards which depict a type of marsupial noted for hopping and bouncing on their hind legs.

Kavu.name: Kavu
Kavu.description: as of ''March of the Machine'' '''Kavu''' is a mainly red and green creature type used for cards that depict carnivorous mutant reptiles with long, low heads, square jaws and four or six legs. They were introduced in the Invasion block.

Killbot.name: Killbot
Killbot.description: as of ''Unsanctioned'' '''Killbot''' is an acorn artifact creature type used for cards that depict robots designed especially for killing. They are currently exclusively used for the ''Unstable'' League of Dastardly Doom. They were invented by Mary O'Kill.

Lamia.name: Lamia
Lamia.description: as of ''Theros Beyond Death'' '''Lamia''' is a creature type introduced in ''Journey into Nyx''.

Lammasu.name: Lammasu
Lammasu.description: as of ''Murders at Karlov Manor'' '''Lammasu''' is a bizarre creature type with the body of a bull, a bird's wings and a human head with horns, based on the Mesopotamian creatures of the same name (and appearance). So far, three lammasu have been printed, all associated with white mana.

Leech.name: Leech
Leech.description: as of ''Duskmourn: House of Horror'' '''Leech''' is a creature type used for cards that depict aquatic bloodsucking or carnivorous worms, sometimes used by physicians to bleed patients. Leeches prey on, and cling to other creatures; they are parasites. They appear in all colors but primarily in black. The first creature to bear the type was Land Leeches from ''The Dark''.

Lemure.name: Lemure
Lemure.description: '''Lemure''' is a obsolete creature type and race that was later given errata to be a Spirit. It represented the wandering and vengeful shade or spirit of those not afforded proper burial though its original art also led it to have confusion with the similarly named animal known as a Lemur.

Lhurgoyf.name: Lhurgoyf
Lhurgoyf.description: as of ''Modern Horizons 3 Commander decks'' '''Lhurgoyf''' is an all-color creature type used for cards that depict large, reptilian creatures, with distinctive elongated limbs and large, toothed mouths. Lhurgoyf are primarily scavengers. They come in a wide variety of shapes depending on their scavenged sustenance of choice.

Licid.name: Licid
Licid.description: as of ''Exodus'' '''Licid''' is a creature type that has only appeared in the Tempest block.

Lobster.name: Lobster
Lobster.description: as of ''Unglued'' '''Lobster''' is an acorn and test card creature type for cards which depict a type of large marine crustacean.

Locus (creature type).name: Locus (creature type)
Locus (creature type).description: as of ''Mystery Booster'' '''Locus''' is a test card creature type representing a type of Insect commonly known as Locusts.

Mammoth.name: Mammoth
Mammoth.description: as of ''Mystery Booster'' '''Mammoth''' is an obsolete and test card creature type for a race of elephantine animals with coats of thick brown hair and long, deeply curved tusks.

Man.name: Man
Man.description: '''Man''' is an unreleased acorn creature type race for creatures who are partially human.

Manticore.name: Manticore
Manticore.description: as of ''Dungeons & Dragons: Adventures in the Forgotten Realms''
planes: Dungeons & Dragons: Adventures in the Forgotten Realms

Mantis.name: Mantis
Mantis.description: '''Mantis''' is an obsolete creature subtype which represented an order of insects with elongated bodies, triangular heads with bulging eyes supported on flexible necks, and greatly enlarged forelegs.

Mist.name: Mist
Mist.description: '''Mist''' is an obsolete creature subtype for cards that represented elemental mist.

Mistfolk.name: Mistfolk
Mistfolk.description: '''Mistfolk''' is an obsolete creature subtype for cards that represented a race of humanoid illusions.

Mongoose.name: Mongoose
Mongoose.description: as of ''Odyssey'' '''Mongoose''' is a green creature type used for cards that depict slender, ferret-like carnivores that feed on rodents, birds, and eggs.

Mummy.name: Mummy
Mummy.description: as of ''Unhinged'' '''Mummy''' is an acorn creature type for undead who are ceremonially preserved and wrapped in bandages.

Naga.name: Naga
Naga.description: as of ''Murders at Karlov Manor'' '''Naga''' is an obsolete creature type that originally was introduced in ''Khans of Tarkir''. Before that, Nagas also had been mentioned in Ravnica's storyline. The type was made obsolete with the release of ''Modern Horizons 3'', with all cards that previous had the Naga type being given errata to be the Snake type to be more consistent with how other humanoid animals are typed.

Nameless Race.name: Nameless Race
Nameless Race.description: '''Nameless Race''' is an obsolete creature type for a race of humanoids from Dominaria. They appear very similar to humans but with a red flame-like marking on their face and a small patch of hair tied back into a ponytail.

Narwhal.name: Narwhal
Narwhal.description: '''Narwhal''' is an obsolete creature subtype which represented a race of horned whales that often inhabit snow regions.

Nautilus.name: Nautilus
Nautilus.description: as of ''The Lost Caverns of Ixalan'' '''Nautilus''' is a blue creature type that was first used for the card Chambered Nautilus from ''Mercadian Masques''. Originally just a Beast, the creature type Nautilus was added in the Grand Creature Type Update.

Necrosavant.name: Necrosavant
Necrosavant.description: '''Necrosavant''' is an obsolete creature subtype for cards that represented a type of giant zombie.

Nephilim.name: Nephilim
Nephilim.description: as of ''Guildpact'' '''Nephilim''' is a creature type unique to the ''Guildpact'' set and the Ravnica plane.

Nightstalker.name: Nightstalker
Nightstalker.description: as of ''Modern Horizons 2'' '''Nightstalker''' is a creature type. Nightstalkers are malevolent black-mana entities from Dominaria. They are roughly humanoid, but have elongated limbs, spiked hair and long, sharp teeth.

Noggle.name: Noggle
Noggle.description: as of ''Eventide'' '''Noggle''' is creature type unique to the Shadowmoor plane. They are aligned with both red and blue mana.

Orb.name: Orb
Orb.description: '''Orb''' is a unique creature type which has only appeared on a token to represent animate, magically-created flying spheres.

Orgg.name: Orgg
Orgg.description: as of ''Onslaught'' '''Orgg''' is a red creature type used for cards that depict a Dominarian race of half-breeds between Orcs and Ogres.

Oyster.name: Oyster
Oyster.description: as of ''Homelands'' '''Oyster''' is a blue creature type that represents a marine, bivalve mollusk with an irregularly shaped calicified shell, occurring on the bottom or adhering to rocks or other objects in shallow water.

Pangolin.name: Pangolin
Pangolin.description: as of ''Ikoria: Lair of Behemoths'' '''Pangolin''' is a black and green creature type used on cards that depicts a mammal with large hardened overlapping plate-like scales covering its skin.

Penguin.name: Penguin
Penguin.description: as of ''Unhinged'' '''Penguin''' is an acorn creature type, used for flightless birds with black upper parts and white underparts and wings developed into flippers for swimming under water.

Pig.name: Pig
Pig.description: as of ''Unhinged'' '''Pig''' is an obsolete and acorn creature type used for cards which depict a type of omnivorous, domesticated, even-toed, hoofed mammal.

Pincher.name: Pincher
Pincher.description: '''Pincher''' is a unique creature subtype which only appears on tokens created by the Summoning Station artifact from ''Fifth Dawn''.

Pony.name: Pony
Pony.description: as of ''Secret Lair Drop Series: Ponies: The Galloping 2 - Extra Life 2023''

Porcupine.name: Porcupine
Porcupine.description: as of ''Outlaws of Thunder Junction'' '''Porcupine''' is a creature type for large rodents with defensive spines or quills on the body and tail.

Present.name: Present
Present.description: '''Present''' is an acorn creature type used for face-down creatures, which are usually wrapped.

Race.name: Race
Race.description: In ''Magic'', '''race''' is a subset of the characteristic "creature type".

Reflection.name: Reflection
Reflection.description: as of ''Duskmourn: House of Horror'' '''Reflection''' is a creature type used for cards and tokens that depict any creature that is an image of another creature, seen in a mirror, on a shiny surface or in the air. The reflection may be specular (i.e. direct) or diffuse according to the nature of the contact surfaces.

Rukh.name: Rukh
Rukh.description: '''Rukh''' is an obsolete token creature type for a race of vulture-like birds with leathery, dragon-like wings native to Rabiah. They are also called stonefeathers as they are similar to phoenixes, except their base element is stone, not fire.

Salamander.name: Salamander
Salamander.description: as of ''The Lost Caverns of Ixalan'' '''Salamander''' is a red, black and blue creature type used for several different types of tailed short-nosed small animals with soft scaleless skin.

Sheep.name: Sheep
Sheep.description: as of ''Duskmourn: House of Horror'' '''Sheep''' is a creature type used for cards that depict ruminant mammals of the genus Ovis, bred in a number of domesticated varieties for wool and meat.

Ship.name: Ship
Ship.description: '''Ship''' is an atypical, and now obsolete, predominantly blue creature type used for cards picturing ships and zeppelins. Pirate Ship established Ship as a creature type all the way back in ''Alpha'', though it would be quite a while before the odd line “Creature — Ship” actually appeared on Talas Air Ship.

Sketch.name: Sketch
Sketch.description: as of ''Unfinity'' '''Sketch''' is a unique acorn colorless creature subtype that represents rough preliminary drawings.

Slith.name: Slith
Slith.description: as of ''Modern Horizons 3'' '''Slith''' is a creature type unique to the plane of ''Mirrodin''. They are depicted as humanoids with large skull-like heads, formed from rock and/or metal.

Spike.name: Spike
Spike.description: as of ''Time Spiral'' '''Spike''' is a creature type first found in the Tempest block. They were likely created or modified for their purpose in Volrath's operating theater in the Stronghold on Rath.

Splinter.name: Splinter
Splinter.description: '''Splinter''' is a unique creature subtype which only appears on tokens that represents small pieces of wood.

Sponge.name: Sponge
Sponge.description: as of ''Commander 2019'' '''Sponge''' is a blue creature type that represents aquatic, chiefly marine animals, which have a porous structure and usually a horny, siliceous or calcareous internal skeleton. They occur in large, sessile colonies.

Spuzzem.name: Spuzzem
Spuzzem.description: as of ''Mystery Booster 2'' '''Spuzzem''' is an obsolete and test card creature type for a race of plant-like elementals on Dominaria.

Squid.name: Squid
Squid.description: as of ''Alchemy: Aetherdrift'' '''Squid''' is a blue creature type used for cards that depict marine cephalopods that feature eight small tentacular arms and two large tentacles. Unlike the closely related octopus, squids have hard spines that define their distinct mantled heads. They tend to flock within large schools, although larger versions may be solitary. Not to be confused with octopuses, nautili, krakens or the sentient Cephalid. Squid creatures have been the smallest of the lot, with th...

Surrakar.name: Surrakar
Surrakar.description: as of ''Aetherdrift'' '''Surrakar''' is a black and blue creature type used for cards that depict a humanoid reptilian race that borders on intelligence. As a creature type, they are unique to Zendikar, and all four Surrakar were printed in original Zendikar block.

Teddy.name: Teddy
Teddy.description: as of ''Unfinity'' '''Teddy''' is an acorn creature type for a a children's toy, made from soft or furry material, which looks like a unfriendly pink bear.

Thalakos.name: Thalakos
Thalakos.description: as of ''Exodus'' '''Thalakos''' is a blue creature type used for cards that depict an insane Spirit-like race of beings trapped in the Shadows of Rath. All have the keyword ability Shadow. The cards as they appeared in the ''Tempest block'' didn't have the subtype Thalakos. It was later realised that a non-human race should have its own subtype, which was fixed in the Grand Creature Type Update.

The Biggest, Baddest, Nastiest, Scariest.name: The Biggest, Baddest, Nastiest, Scariest Creature You'll Ever See
The Biggest, Baddest, Nastiest, Scariest.description: as of ''Unglued'' '''The Biggest, Baddest, Nastiest, Scariest Creature You'll Ever See''' is an acorn creature type. It exists only on the creature from ''Unglued''.

Tree.name: Tree
Tree.description: as of ''2023 Barcelona Unknown Event'' '''Tree''' is a test card-only creature race used to represent non-sentient trees. Normally Treefolk is used to represent sentient tree creatures, and regular trees are categorized as plants (e.g. ).

Trilobite.name: Trilobite
Trilobite.description: as of ''Modern Horizons 3'' '''Trilobite''' is a creature type used for cards that depict a prehistoric marine arthropod with a carapace over the forepart, and a segmented hind part divided longitudinally into three lobes.

Undead.name: Undead
Undead.description: '''Undead''' is an obsolete creature type that appeared on three cards from the ''Weatherlight'' set: , Odylic Wraith and Urborg Stalker. In the Grand Creature Type Update these were changed to creature type Horror, Wraith, and Horror respectively.

Vampyre.name: Vampyre
Vampyre.description: as of ''Unstable'' '''Vampyre''' is an acorn creature type for ye olde-style Vampires.

Vegetable.name: Vegetable
Vegetable.description: '''Vegetable''' is an unreleased acorn race of animated parts of plants normally consumed as food.

Villain.name: Villain
Villain.description: as of ''Unstable'' '''Villain''' is an acorn and future eternal creature class used for evil-doers. It was originally a race before being made obsolete in the Grand Creature Type Update.

Volver.name: Volver
Volver.description: as of ''Apocalypse'' '''Volver''' is a creature type unique to ''Apocalypse''. Volvers are a cycle of mutant abominations that resulted from the Rathi Overlay. Volvers were particularly noteworthy in their counter-evolutionary synthesis of three different colors of magic—two allied and one opposed.
